Welspun living, earlier known as welspun India is reshaping modern living. Committed to ?doing the right things the right way?, we enhance living environments authentically, reflecting personal style for healthier, happier life. With presence in 50+ countries, from home textiles, hard and soft flooring and advanced non woven textiles, welspun living offers a holistic approach that resonates with the modern consumer's desire for both style and comfort. Adwaith lakshmi is a well known textile corporate group from coimbatore, south India. Adwaith expanded its portfolio by integrating the spinning business and established the home textile division in 2010. Our decision to foray into this new avenue was underpinned by our confidence and expertise in the textile industry for several decades. Adwaith lakshmi has a dynamic and scalable terry towel production facility that has the capability of producing high quality terry towels. Bath robes, bath mats, blankets, linen, in piece dyed, yarn dyed, both dobby and jacquard with a wide range of finishing. Our innovative designs, technology adapted in spinning, weaving, finishing, Reflect the uniqueness in the collection and capabilities keep expanding to meet the unique needs of our customers. Our products are exported to about 32 countries world wide. The group takes utmost care for the environment and focuses on sustainability, circularity in every stage of the business. The group keeps investing largely on yd technologies that use less water in processing of textiles, recycling 100% (zld) zero liquid discharge ,wind power, solar power. The company has become 84% carbon neutral , and aim to become 100% carbon neutral in 2024. The products are certified by oekotex, gots. Factories are compliant with iso, sa 8000, bsci, ics. We truly believe in giving back to our society and we remain at the fore front in terms of discharging our corporate social responsibility ( csr) as a duty. We extend our warm welcome to visit us, at bharat tex 2024, which is a fabulous initiative of our government to show case all segments of textiles in one roof.

At flora international, we are more than just a manufacturer of home furnishing textiles; we are a passionate, dedicated, and socially responsible organization based in India. With a history dating back to 1984, our commitment to excellence and innovation has made us a preferred supplier to numerous textile retailers and wholesalers around the world. Our vision: Flora international is a company driven by the passion to make a difference – a difference to our employees, customers, suppliers, community, and the entire textile industry. Our legacy: Established in 1984 by the legendary late mr. Pardeep jain, flora international has an unmatched legacy in the industry. Today, the company is under the visionary leadership of varun jain, mr. Pardeep jain's son. Our reputation: Over the years, flora international has not only become a brand in itself but also a trusted supplier for many textile retailers and wholesalers worldwide. Our enduring relationships with clients spanning over 39 years testify to our unwavering commitment to our buyers. Social responsibility: We take pride in being an sa 8000:2014 certified company, with a strong focus on social, legal, and environmental compliance. Our ethical practices have earned us certifications from various retailers around the globe. Additionally, we are recognized as a govt. Of India export house and have been honored with prestigious awards. Innovation and creativity: Our sheer passion and dedication to continuous product development are evident in our extensive range of textiles. We are market leaders in innovative designs and trends, blending cutting-edge technology with centuries-old traditions in floor covering craftsmanship. Our creativity shines through as we tailor our products to meet the specific requirements of our diverse customer base worldwide. Product range: Flora international offers a wide variety of home furnishing textiles, including: Carpets, rugs, bathmats, poufs, baskets, throws, kitchen textiles (placemat/runner), floor seating and wall arts Versatile manufacturing: Our manufacturing process is versatile, allowing us to cater to both large retail orders and custom-made, specialized orders. We serve prominent markets in germany, austria, poland, and spain. We are dedicated to keeping our customers satisfied and happy by providing competitive prices, unmatched quality, and exceptional service and support. For almost 4 decades, flora international has strived to set industry benchmarks for quality, innovation, and ethical responsibility. We look forward to continuing our journey, fulfilling the needs of our customers, and contributing positively to our community.

Gloster limited was incorporated on 2nd january 1923 under the provisions of the companies act 1913. Gloster limited having its registered office at 21, strand road, kolkata – 700001, west bengal is engaged in manufacturing and exporting of all types of jute & jute allied products. Company’s two manufacturing units are situated at bauria, p.O. Fort gloster, district howrah in the state of west bengal, India. The house of bangurs as one of the leading business conglomerates acquired the mills of gloster in the year 1954. Gloster employs around 4,500 people and has a production capacity of 50,000 m.Ton per annum. Gloster’s manufacturing units not only have the modern jute manufacturing processes but are also certified for quality management system, having certificate for iso 9001:2015. Apart from that gloster is a very conscious company as far as environmental aspects and health & safety of their employees are concerned and is certified under iso 14001:2015 for environment management system and iso 45001:2018 for occupational health & safety management system. Gloster exports goods to most of the developed countries directly like usa, uk, european countries, japan, australia etc. The financials of the company for the current year and past 3 years are given hereunder: Rs. In crores Year ended / period ended revenue from operation profit before tax profit after tax net worth 31/03/2023 710 79 61 1,092 31/03/2022 734 111 73 1,076 31/03/2021 493 64 45 992 Gloster’s authorised share capital is rs. 27.50 Crores divided into 2.75 Crore equity shares of rs.10/- Each. Gloster product profile can be broadly classified into a) traditional products such as hessian, yarn, sacking etc., B) technical products such as geo-textiles, agro-textiles, fabrics treated for fire retardancy, microbial attacks, hydrocarbon-free jute bags, jute leno fabrics etc. And c) lifestyle products such as floor covering, processed decorative, furnishing fabrics, bags & made ups, jute mats etc. The company has also added new technical products namely bags & made ups, laminated jute fabrics, washed jute canvas, coated fabrics for soft luggage, coated molleton fabrics, all types of light natural & dyed yarns / ropes and non-woven products. The company acts as a one-stop shop for all kinds of jute products available in the market. Gloster has been endorsing sustainability since the time sustainability was just another term in environmental science. Jute gloster and sustainability have become almost synonymous over the years. Gloster tries its best to sustain the resources of the society by opting for sustainable development. While producing high quality jute and jute allied products gloster ensures optimum use of renewable resources and re-cycleable products. Gloster believes in sustainability reporting and sustainability report for the years 2012-13 to 2021-2022 are in place.
Unit No. 1 1st Floor Jv Patel Compound 38, Elphinstone Road, Mumbai 400013 Maharashtra India

Amritsar swadeshi textile corporation pvt ltd (astc) was started in 1957 as a blanket manufacturing unit in amritsar. Today it has become one of India’s premier organisations in heavy woollen and blanket manufacturing industry. It is a conglomerate of units situated in various parts of the country engaged in the entire spectrum of woollen blanket and fabric manufacturing right from the basic raw material. The woollen plant is one of its kind in India and has the complete facility to convert right from raw material to fabrics/blankets without any assistance from external units. The spinning plants cater to the needs of a varied range of products from coarse yarn counts like 2nm to 6nm for manufacture of blankets to yarn counts like 6 nm to 20 nm for manufacture of fabrics and knitwear along with a complete fiber dyeing facility. Astc has the installed milling cum scouring machines, raising cum shearing machines and automatic shearing machines which make its processing plant the most modern facility in India with the latest technology available for woollen fabric and blanket finishing. Taking jaipur to the world _ rasa jaipur Rasa came in to being in 1998 amongst the vibrant colours, design and true Indian culture of jaipur, a city where heritage meets contemporary. Synonymous with this city is the 12th century traditional art form of hand block printing, which forms the essence of all rasa creations. While retaining and honing its heritage, we are constantly pushing the boundaries of innovation in this medium. Our passion of taking jaipur to the world inspires us. We design and manufacture fashion clothing and home textiles in ways that improve the lives of the artisans and touch the sensibilities of all our customers in a very special way. We are dedicated to our global partners for whom we have been manufacturing high quality products for decades. We are deeply committed to design excellence, preservation of ancient crafts, environmental sustainability and women-economic empowerment. What started as a small design studio, today supports hundreds of artisans and allied professionals. Rasa manufactures and partners with several well known international brands from across the world; while also creating and retailing its signature rasa portfolio. Our team is headed by madhulika singh tibrewal (nift & nid) in design, manish tibrewal (delhi university & nift) in operations and neeraj tibrewal (delhi university & xlri) in finance & logistics. Rasa creates - heritage meets contemporary What started as a tiny one room workshop with half a block printing table, today includes proficiency in several skills - dozens of hand block printing tables, screen, rotary and digital printing techniques. Our in house hand quilting, hand embroidery, machine embroidery and hand painting; add the desired enhancements to our printed textiles. Our skilled printers and tailors are backed by a team of dedicated designers, merchandisers and supervisors at every stage of the process, comprising an equal number of men and women. Rasa cares At rasa, we use 100% natural fibres - silk, linen, cotton, hemp and wool. All dyes and dyestuff used in our processes are azo and pthalates free. We experimented with natural dyes when we began and with efforts over the years, have now managed to achieve globally acceptable standards and consistency in this medium. We are an sa-8000 - 2014 certified company for social compliance. Rasa is at the forefront of women’s economic empowerment. We are constantly creating opportunities for hundreds of women and artisans to become financially independent through skill upgradation. Rasa is a trusted partner for global brands Rasa has had long and trusted relationships with large global brands. We are the trusted manufacturing partners for john robshaw, a new york based designer, for over two decades. Our relationship with crate and barrel and cb2 of 12 years is mostly around designing and manufacturing home textiles. Our other global partners include anthropologie, four seasons resort, michael smith inc and abc carpet and home. We retail the rasa fashion line with readsonline australia and have collaborated with them to develop the “bagruu” clothing brand. We work with over 100 modern sewing machines across three manufacturing locations. Monthly, these can produce 15,000 sheet sets, 4,000 quilts (hand quilted), 30,000 pillows, 2,500 pieces of fashion clothing, amongst others. Design & development You imagine it, and we bring it to life. Our experienced design team understands your needs, aligns it with the changing global environment, and helps create unique styles and patterns as per your business requirement. Traditional methods as well as modern software, both are used by us in the design development processes. A 100% quality assurance Quality is the heart of our business, an area where we do not compromise. Quality control begins from the sourcing of materials to delivering at the customer's doorstep. Most processes are in-house till the finishing and packaging stages. This ensures a high-quality delivery of merchandise to you each time, every time. On-time delivery Our fully dedicated and experienced team understands the importance of timely deliveries in the competitive market today. We deliver what we commit and will go the extra mile to honour our commitment. Material and product diversity Our fabrics are sourced from some of the finest weavers in the country. Silks from the handlooms of bhagalpur, mp and varanasi linens from bangalore and bhagalpur, wools and pashmina from the weavers in kashmir, soft sheeting 200 -1000 tc from the mills in south India, cottons – plains and yarn dyed from the handloom (khadi) and mill sectors, bespoke fabrics from weavers across the country. These are augmented with quality trims and accessories often embellished with embroideries and hand stitches. Our products include bed linen, decorative pillows, quilts, coverlets and throw blankets, shower curtains and mats, table linen and fashion apparel.

Kalanjali brand story Kalanjali is acclaimed for the exclusive collection of traditional sarees, ethnic ladies wear , Indian artefacts , handcrafted furniture and hand-looms textiles . It's a journey of discovery into centuries old traditions. Kalanjali (a division of margadarsi marketing private limited) is a part of the ramoji group. The parent group's business interests include publishing, film production and distribution, film studios, satellite television, financial services, hospitality and tourism, processed foods and retail. Kalanjali launched in 1992 is a retail chain store consisting of 5 showrooms with presence in southern states of India (andhra pradesh and telangana) and ecommerce sites with a strong global clientele. Kalanjali houses genuine silks, classic designs in sarees in kanjivaram, upadda , pochampally , paithani , kalamkari , venkatagiri , narayanpet , mangalagiri to name a few. Kalanjali has forayed into contemporary ethnic wear in women’s , men’s and kids apparels in handlooms and block printed natural fabrics using natural dyes . We specialise in indigenous block printing of kalamkari , bagru , ajrakh , bagh , mangalgiri , ikats - pochampally & sambalpur. Our ceo personally works with the team to create this range. Our clothing line focuses on quality, workmanship and sustainability. We also design exclusive handcrafted furniture, stone and marble carving as per the customer requirement as well as corporate gift items. The task of reviving these dying art forms , working with the artisans & craftsmen , and overcoming the region specific limitations requires creativity and consistent effort at the grass root level . Visit our websites www.Kalanjali.Com & www.Kalanjaliethnics.Com (apparels)

Adhyyan craftsmanship was initiated by our founder ms. Arisha rastogi when she realized while pursuing her master’s at the parsons, new york, united states that the Indian art & motifs are used by the fashion industries universally without any recognition of the artists behind them! Our rich Indian cultural heritage needed to be expressed aloud to the world! Our initiative got the right direction during covid-19 when many women were thrown out of their regular jobs and were unable to find work no to the pandemic. Few of them also faced discrimination because of belonging to a caste or tribe. Hearing about the initiative a few women got in touch with us, initially we trained them with basic knowledge of knitting and different skill field set like painting, stitching, crocheting, etc. With time and effort we all grew together and today adhhyan craftsmanship support around 35 women artisans from different backgrounds. Today the women artisans of adhyyan craftsmanship make hand painted and handmade crochet products like apparel, accessories, home decor with the magic of their hands. From the final end product to its packaging everything is done by our women artisans. Team adhyyan craftsmanship emphasize on utmost quality checks to deliver the finest handicrafts of our women artisans. From making hand crafted products for someone's home to exporting their hand crafted products our women artisans has come a long way!

About us Anavila: from the sanskrit word “??????”, meaning pure, wholesome and clear. Our aim is clear. Our clothes must tell stories. We are a design travelogue, moving from state to state, exploring every local craft our glorious country has to offer. Every season, anavila focuses on one indigenous design skill, with artisans whose creations are a result of years of history and careful technique, passed on from one pair of masterful hands to the next. Our team of young, passionate, visionary designers works with these artisans to combine our contemporary styles with their traditional m?tier, updating and revising motifs and colours, to bring to you clothes which are fragrant with classic design, and yet modern, edgy and chic. Our aim is wholesome. Our clothes must be sustainable and responsible. We focus on natural fabrics, and accomplished, dexterous technique done by hand. Conscientious, environmentally friendly design is at the core of anavila’s philosophy. Our factories are based on environmental literacy plans and our designing, sampling and production are all sustainable, meticulous and responsible. We believe in exploring the beauty of history and fashion without violating the integrity of nature. All resources utilized in the process of dyeing/ printing etc are regulated by the authorities and we ensure proper treatment and purification before it is released. We strictly do not use any azoic dyes in our process. Our aim is pure. Our clothes must come through an entirely transparent production line. We work directly with our artisans and craftsmen, with no mediators and no middlemen. Every single craftsperson we work with receives fair wage. We do not bargain with skill. We do not haggle with tradition. We believe that it is a privilege to wear a garment handcrafted specially for you from beginning to end, and we want to bring that privilege to you. We do not under any circumstance allow the use of child labor for any process of manufacturing. We also are deeply involved with women run artisanal groups across rajasthan & west bengal.
